title: Embracing ugly veg and the ugly side of poultry production to make more profitable and sustainable products - FoodNavigator.com
summary: Reduced and Caldic are collaborating to explore and scale upcycled ingredients for the food industry, aiming to reduce food waste and promote innovation in upcycling.
green_innovation: TRUE. This collaboration aligns with green innovation as it focuses on reducing food waste and developing sustainable processes in the food industry.
business_innovation: TRUE. The collaboration between Reduced and Caldic to develop upcycled ingredients for the food industry can be considered a business innovation as it introduces new products and processes to the market.
green_product: TRUE. The collaboration between Reduced and Caldic to create organic flavour enhancers from upcycled ingredients aligns with the definition of a green product by significantly reducing environmental impact throughout the product's lifecycle.
green_process: TRUE. The collaboration's focus on upcycling ingredients for the food industry involves methods that minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability, making it a green process.
product_or_process: Flavour enhancers based on upcycled ingredients for the food industry

greenwashing: FALSE. The article does not demonstrate greenwashing as the collaboration between Reduced and Caldic focuses on genuine efforts to reduce food waste and promote sustainability in the food industry.

title: TerraCycle takes recycling to a whole new level - Inhabitat

green_innovation: TRUE. This is green innovation because TerraCycle's recycling program promotes environmental sustainability goals by reducing waste and promoting recycling and upcycling.
business_innovation: TRUE. The introduction of TerraCycle's recycling program that offers a new method and process for recycling materials not traditionally recyclable signifies a business innovation.
green_product: TRUE. TerraCycle's products and processes aim to significantly reduce environmental impact throughout their life cycle by promoting recycling, upcycling, and waste reduction.
green_process: TRUE. TerraCycle's operational activities focus on minimizing environmental impacts, promoting sustainability, reducing waste, and conserving resources, aligning with the definition of a green process.

title: This engineer created a sustainable brand to upcycle waste fabric and clothes - YourStory
summary: Sujata Chatterjee founded Twirl, a Kolkata-based initiative focused on reducing fabric wastage, empowering women, conserving natural resources, and providing clothing to the less fortunate through upcycling unwanted clothes and fabric.
green_innovation: TRUE. This initiative by Sujata Chatterjee to reduce cloth wastage, empower women, conserve natural resources, and create sustainable products through upcycling aligns with the definition of green innovation, as it contributes to environmental sustainability, nature conservation, and reducing negative environmental impacts.
business_innovation: TRUE. Twirl.Store, founded by Sujata Chatterjee, introduces a new business process that significantly differs from traditional clothing retail models by upcycling unwanted clothes and fabric to create sustainable products, thereby meeting the criteria for business innovation.
green_product: TRUE. The upcycled products created by Twirl.Store, such as bags, accessories, and gift items, are designed to significantly reduce environmental impact throughout their lifecycle by repurposing unwanted clothing and fabric, promoting sustainability, and supporting recycling efforts.
green_process: TRUE. The upcycling process employed by Twirl in converting unwanted clothes and fabric into new products like bags and accessories minimizes environmental impacts, reduces waste, conserves natural resources, and promotes sustainability, aligning with the definition of a green process.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 315990 - Apparel Accessories and Other Apparel Manufacturing, 424330 - Women's, Children's, and Infants' Clothing and Accessories Merchant Wholesalers, 448190 - Other Clothing Stores, 453998 - All Other Miscellaneous Store Retailers
greenwashing: FALSE. The article does not exhibit greenwashing as the focus is on genuine efforts to address fabric wastage, empower women, and promote sustainability through upcycling, without misleading or overstating environmental claims for marketing purposes.
